snippet.title: Johnny Depp vowed to 'drown, burn and f*** ex Amber Heard'
snippet.description:
Thanks for watching my video. 
If you like my videos, please subscribe to the channel to receive the latest videos 
Videos can use content-based copyright law contains reasonable use Fair Use (https://www.youtube.com/yt/copyright/). 
For any copyright, please send me a message. HOLLYWOOD heart-throb Johnny Depp vowed to “drown, burn and f***” his ex Amber Heard, a court heard on Wednesday.  The threat was disclosed at a hearing in London, ahead of a High Court showdown between the warring couple next month.    Other ranting texts from the star detailing his wild booze and drugs benders were also read out at the pre-trial hearing, which Depp attended all day.  It heard that the Pirates of the Caribbean star, 56, refuted claims from Heard that he beat her and he now wanted his name cleared.  The Aquaman actress, 33, had publicly alleged she feared for her life after he choked her and ripped out her hair in more than a dozen violent rows.  Depp is taking libel action against The Sun over a 2018 article questioning the actor’s casting in the Fantastic Beasts movie.  Executive editor Dan Wootton had challenged its creator JK Rowling to answer five key points in the face of Heard’s claims.  Depp’s barrister David Sherborne said on Wednesday: “These are extremely serious criminal allegations made against Mr Depp by Ms Heard and he has a right to have himself publicly vindicated.”  He went on: “It is black and white. One person is lying and one is not. We say it is Ms Heard, and Mr Depp is 100 per cent clear about that.” WHAT DEPP TEXTS SAY  Explosive texts from Depp to his Brit actor pal Paul Bettany were later read out at the High Court.  The court heard 70,000 messages were disclosed in error to The Sun’s lawyers — and other relevant texts may be missing.    One from Depp to Bettany in 2013 said: “Let’s burn Amber. Let’s drown her before we burn her!!! I will f*** her burnt corpse afterwards to make sure she’s dead.”  Another rambling text to Bettany the next year detailed a wild drink and drugs bender.  The court heard Depp wrote: “I’m gonna properly stop the booze thing darling. Drank all night before I picked Amber up to fly to LA this past Sunday . . . Ugly, mate . . . no food for days . . . powders . . . half a bottle of whiskey, a thousand Red Bull and vodkas, pills, two bottles of champers on plane and what do you get . . . an angry aggro Injun in a f***in blackout screaming obscenities and insulting any f*** who got near. I’m done. I am admittedly too f***ed in the head to spray my rage at the one I love . . . for little reasons, as well I’m too old to be that guy — but pills are fine.!!!” AMBER HEARD CLAIMS  Adam Wolanski, representing The Sun, said it was sent after Heard accused him of throwing objects at her in a drunken rage on a private jet from Boston to LA. Mr Wolanski said the text was at odds with Depp’s claims he had not been drinking on the flight.  The barrister said: “He pushed a chair at her, yelled and taunted her, slapped h
